args.description:
An optional subpath of the directory which contains the module's source
code.

This is needed when the module code is in a subdirectory but requires
parent directories to be loaded in order to execute. For example, the
module source code may need a go.mod, project.toml, package.json, etc. file
from a parent directory.

If not set, the module source code is loaded from the root of the
directory.

args.description:
Ports to expose via the service, forwarding through the host network.

If a port's frontend is unspecified or 0, it defaults to the same as the
backend port.

An empty set of ports is not valid; an error will be returned.
args.name: ports

args.description: Upstream host to forward traffic to.
args.name: host

fields.description: Creates a service that forwards traffic to a specified address via the host.
fields.name: service

args.description: The user defined name for this secret.
args.name: name

args.description: Location of the file to set as a secret.
args.name: path

fields.description:
Sets a secret given a user-defined name and the file path on the host, and returns the secret.
The file is limited to a size of 512000 bytes.
fields.name: setSecretFile

args.description: Service to send traffic from the tunnel.
args.name: service

args.description:
Map each service port to the same port on the host, as if the service were
running natively.

Note: enabling may result in port conflicts.
args.name: native

args.description:
Configure explicit port forwarding rules for the tunnel.

If a port's frontend is unspecified or 0, a random port will be chosen by
the host.

If no ports are given, all of the service's ports are forwarded. If native
is true, each port maps to the same port on the host. If native is false,
each port maps to a random port chosen by the host.

If ports are given and native is true, the ports are additive.
args.name: ports

fields.description: Creates a tunnel that forwards traffic from the host to a service.
fields.name: tunnel

args.description: Location of the Unix socket (e.g., "/var/run/docker.sock").
args.name: path

fields.description: Accesses a Unix socket on the host.
fields.name: unixSocket

types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a object definition.

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.
enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.
enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.
enumValues.name: MUTATION

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.
enumValues.name: SCHEMA

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.
enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.
enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.
enumValues.name: ENUM

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.
enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.
enumValues.name: FIELD

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.
enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.
enumValues.name: UNION

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.
enumValues.name: INTERFACE

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.
enumValues.name: QUERY

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.
enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.
enumValues.name: SCALAR

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.
enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION

types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.
types.name: String

fields.description: The argument values the function is being invoked with.

fields.description: The name of the function being called.
fields.name: name

fields.description:
The value of the parent object of the function being called.
If the function is "top-level" to the module, this is always an empty object.
fields.name: parent

fields.description:
The name of the parent object of the function being called.
If the function is "top-level" to the module, this is the name of the module.
fields.name: parentName

fields.description:
Set the return value of the function call to the provided value.
The value should be a string of the JSON serialization of the return value.
fields.name: returnValue

types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document. 

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.
types.name: __Directive

types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.
types.name: ID

types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.
types.name: Int

types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.
types.name: __Type

types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is

enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.
enumValues.name: SCALAR

enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.
enumValues.name: OBJECT

enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.
enumValues.name: INTERFACE

enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.
enumValues.name: UNION

enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.
enumValues.name: ENUM

enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.
enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT

enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.
enumValues.name: LIST

enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.
enumValues.name: NON_NULL

types.name: __TypeKind

types.description: A unique identifier for a secret.
types.name: SecretID

The absense of a value.

A Null Void is used as a placeholder for resolvers that do not return anything.

fields.name: queryType

fields.description: If this server supports subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.
fields.name: subscriptionType

fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.
fields.name: types

args.description: The exposed port number for the endpoint
args.name: port

args.description: Return a URL with the given scheme, eg. http for http://
args.name: scheme

fields.description:
Retrieves an endpoint that clients can use to reach this container.

If no port is specified, the first exposed port is used. If none exist an error is returned.

If a scheme is specified, a URL is returned. Otherwise, a host:port pair is returned.
fields.name: endpoint

fields.description: Retrieves a hostname which can be used by clients to reach this container.
fields.name: hostname

fields.description: A unique identifier for this service.
fields.name: id

fields.description: Retrieves the list of ports provided by the service.
fields.name: ports

fields.description:
Start the service and wait for its health checks to succeed.

Services bound to a Container do not need to be manually started.
fields.name: start

fields.description: Stop the service.
fields.name: stop

types.description: Distinguishes the different kinds of TypeDefs.

enumValues.description: A string value
enumValues.name: StringKind

enumValues.description: An integer value
enumValues.name: IntegerKind

enumValues.description: A boolean value
enumValues.name: BooleanKind

enumValues.description:
A list of values all having the same type.

Always paired with a ListTypeDef.
enumValues.name: ListKind

enumValues.description:
A named type defined in the GraphQL schema, with fields and functions.

Always paired with an ObjectTypeDef.
enumValues.name: ObjectKind

enumValues.description:
A special kind used to signify that no value is returned.

This is used for functions that have no return value. The outer TypeDef
specifying this Kind is always Optional, as the Void is never actually
represented.
enumValues.name: VoidKind

types.name: TypeDefKind

fields.description: The content-addressed identifier of the socket.
fields.name: id

types.description: A git ref (tag, branch or commit).

fields.description: The resolved commit id at this ref.
fields.name: commit

fields.description: The filesystem tree at this ref.
fields.name: tree

types.name: GitRef

types.description: The `DateTime` scalar type represents a DateTime. The DateTime is serialized as an RFC 3339 quoted string
types.name: DateTime

types.description: An OCI-compatible container, also known as a docker container.

fields.description:
Turn the container into a Service.

Be sure to set any exposed ports before this conversion.
fields.name: asService

args.description:
Identifiers for other platform specific containers.
Used for multi-platform image.
args.name: platformVariants

args.description:
Force each layer of the image to use the specified compression algorithm.
If this is unset, then if a layer already has a compressed blob in the engine's
cache, that will be used (this can result in a mix of compression algorithms for
different layers). If this is unset and a layer has no compressed blob in the
engine's cache, then it will be compressed using Gzip.
args.name: forcedCompression

args.description:
Use the specified media types for the image's layers. Defaults to OCI, which
is largely compatible with most recent container runtimes, but Docker may be needed
for older runtimes without OCI support.
args.name: mediaTypes

fields.description: Returns a File representing the container serialized to a tarball.
fields.name: asTarball

args.description: Directory context used by the Dockerfile.
args.name: context

args.description:
Path to the Dockerfile to use.

Default: './Dockerfile'.
args.name: dockerfile

args.description: Additional build arguments.
args.name: buildArgs

args.description: Target build stage to build.
args.name: target

args.description:
Secrets to pass to the build.

They will be mounted at /run/secrets/[secret-name] in the build container

They can be accessed in the Dockerfile using the "secret" mount type
and mount path /run/secrets/[secret-name]
e.g. RUN --mount=type=secret,id=my-secret curl url?token=$(cat /run/secrets/my-secret)"
args.name: secrets

fields.description: Initializes this container from a Dockerfile build.
fields.name: build

fields.description: Retrieves default arguments for future commands.
fields.name: defaultArgs

args.description: The path of the directory to retrieve (e.g., "./src").
args.name: path

fields.description:
Retrieves a directory at the given path.

Mounts are included.
fields.name: directory

fields.description: Retrieves entrypoint to be prepended to the arguments of all commands.
fields.name: entrypoint

args.description: The name of the environment variable to retrieve (e.g., "PATH").
args.name: name

fields.description: Retrieves the value of the specified environment variable.
fields.name: envVariable

fields.description: Retrieves the list of environment variables passed to commands.
fields.name: envVariables

args.description:
Host's destination path (e.g., "./tarball").
Path can be relative to the engine's workdir or absolute.
args.name: path

args.description:
Identifiers for other platform specific containers.
Used for multi-platform image.
args.name: platformVariants

args.description:
Force each layer of the exported image to use the specified compression algorithm.
If this is unset, then if a layer already has a compressed blob in the engine's
cache, that will be used (this can result in a mix of compression algorithms for
different layers). If this is unset and a layer has no compressed blob in the
engine's cache, then it will be compressed using Gzip.
args.name: forcedCompression

args.description:
Use the specified media types for the exported image's layers. Defaults to OCI, which
is largely compatible with most recent container runtimes, but Docker may be needed
for older runtimes without OCI support.
args.name: mediaTypes

fields.description:
Writes the container as an OCI tarball to the destination file path on the host for the specified platform variants.

Return true on success.
It can also publishes platform variants.
fields.name: export

fields.description:
Retrieves the list of exposed ports.

This includes ports already exposed by the image, even if not
explicitly added with dagger.
fields.name: exposedPorts

args.description: The path of the file to retrieve (e.g., "./README.md").
args.name: path

fields.description:
Retrieves a file at the given path.

Mounts are included.
fields.name: file

args.description:
Image's address from its registry.

Formatted as [host]/[user]/[repo]:[tag] (e.g., "docker.io/dagger/dagger:main").
args.name: address

fields.description: Initializes this container from a pulled base image.
fields.name: from

fields.description: A unique identifier for this container.
fields.name: id

fields.description: The unique image reference which can only be retrieved immediately after the 'Container.From' call.
fields.name: imageRef

args.description: File to read the container from.
args.name: source

args.description:
Identifies the tag to import from the archive, if the archive bundles
multiple tags.
args.name: tag

fields.description:
Reads the container from an OCI tarball.

NOTE: this involves unpacking the tarball to an OCI store on the host at
$XDG_CACHE_DIR/dagger/oci. This directory can be removed whenever you like.
fields.name: import

fields.description: Retrieves the value of the specified label.
fields.name: label

fields.description: Retrieves the list of labels passed to container.
fields.name: labels

fields.description: Retrieves the list of paths where a directory is mounted.
fields.name: mounts

args.description: Pipeline name.
args.name: name

args.description: Pipeline description.
args.name: description

args.description: Pipeline labels.
args.name: labels

fields.description: Creates a named sub-pipeline
fields.name: pipeline

fields.description: The platform this container executes and publishes as.
fields.name: platform

args.description:
Registry's address to publish the image to.

Formatted as [host]/[user]/[repo]:[tag] (e.g. "docker.io/dagger/dagger:main").
args.name: address

args.description:
Identifiers for other platform specific containers.
Used for multi-platform image.
args.name: platformVariants

args.description:
Force each layer of the published image to use the specified compression algorithm.
If this is unset, then if a layer already has a compressed blob in the engine's
cache, that will be used (this can result in a mix of compression algorithms for
different layers). If this is unset and a layer has no compressed blob in the
engine's cache, then it will be compressed using Gzip.
args.name: forcedCompression

args.description:
Use the specified media types for the published image's layers. Defaults to OCI, which
is largely compatible with most recent registries, but Docker may be needed for older
registries without OCI support.
args.name: mediaTypes

fields.description:
Publishes this container as a new image to the specified address.

Publish returns a fully qualified ref.
It can also publish platform variants.
fields.name: publish

fields.description: Retrieves this container's root filesystem. Mounts are not included.
fields.name: rootfs

fields.description:
Return a websocket endpoint that, if connected to, will start the container with a TTY streamed
over the websocket.

Primarily intended for internal use with the dagger CLI.
fields.name: shellEndpoint

fields.description:
The error stream of the last executed command.

Will execute default command if none is set, or error if there's no default.
fields.name: stderr

fields.description:
The output stream of the last executed command.

Will execute default command if none is set, or error if there's no default.
fields.name: stdout

fields.description:
Forces evaluation of the pipeline in the engine.

It doesn't run the default command if no exec has been set.
fields.name: sync

fields.description: Retrieves the user to be set for all commands.
fields.name: user

args.description: Arguments to prepend to future executions (e.g., ["-v", "--no-cache"]).
args.name: args

fields.description: Configures default arguments for future commands.
fields.name: withDefaultArgs

args.description: Location of the written directory (e.g., "/tmp/directory").
args.name: path

args.description: Identifier of the directory to write
args.name: directory

args.description: Patterns to exclude in the written directory (e.g., ["node_modules/**", ".gitignore", ".git/"]).
args.name: exclude

args.description: Patterns to include in the written directory (e.g., ["*.go", "go.mod", "go.sum"]).
args.name: include

args.description:
A user:group to set for the directory and its contents.

The user and group can either be an ID (1000:1000) or a name (foo:bar).

If the group is omitted, it defaults to the same as the user.
args.name: owner

fields.description: Retrieves this container plus a directory written at the given path.
fields.name: withDirectory

args.description: Entrypoint to use for future executions (e.g., ["go", "run"]).
args.name: args

fields.description: Retrieves this container but with a different command entrypoint.
fields.name: withEntrypoint

args.description: The name of the environment variable (e.g., "HOST").
args.name: name

args.description: The value of the environment variable. (e.g., "localhost").
args.name: value

args.description:
Replace ${VAR} or $VAR in the value according to the current environment
variables defined in the container (e.g., "/opt/bin:$PATH").
args.name: expand

fields.description: Retrieves this container plus the given environment variable.
fields.name: withEnvVariable

args.description:
Command to run instead of the container's default command (e.g., ["run", "main.go"]).

If empty, the container's default command is used.
args.name: args

args.description: If the container has an entrypoint, ignore it for args rather than using it to wrap them.
args.name: skipEntrypoint

args.description: Content to write to the command's standard input before closing (e.g., "Hello world").
args.name: stdin

args.description: Redirect the command's standard output to a file in the container (e.g., "/tmp/stdout").
args.name: redirectStdout

args.description: Redirect the command's standard error to a file in the container (e.g., "/tmp/stderr").
args.name: redirectStderr

args.description:
Provides dagger access to the executed command.

Do not use this option unless you trust the command being executed.
The command being executed WILL BE GRANTED FULL ACCESS TO YOUR HOST FILESYSTEM.
args.name: experimentalPrivilegedNesting

args.description:
Execute the command with all root capabilities. This is similar to running a command
with "sudo" or executing `docker run` with the `--privileged` flag. Containerization
does not provide any security guarantees when using this option. It should only be used
when absolutely necessary and only with trusted commands.
args.name: insecureRootCapabilities

fields.description: Retrieves this container after executing the specified command inside it.
fields.name: withExec

args.description: Port number to expose
args.name: port

args.description: Transport layer network protocol
args.name: protocol

args.description: Optional port description
args.name: description

fields.description:
Expose a network port.

Exposed ports serve two purposes:
  - For health checks and introspection, when running services
  - For setting the EXPOSE OCI field when publishing the container
fields.name: withExposedPort

args.description: Location of the copied file (e.g., "/tmp/file.txt").
args.name: path

args.description: Identifier of the file to copy.
args.name: source

args.description:
Permission given to the copied file (e.g., 0600).

Default: 0644.
args.name: permissions

args.description:
A user:group to set for the file.

The user and group can either be an ID (1000:1000) or a name (foo:bar).

If the group is omitted, it defaults to the same as the user.
args.name: owner

fields.description: Retrieves this container plus the contents of the given file copied to the given path.
fields.name: withFile

fields.description:
Indicate that subsequent operations should be featured more prominently in
the UI.
fields.name: withFocus

args.description: The name of the label (e.g., "org.opencontainers.artifact.created").
args.name: name

args.description: The value of the label (e.g., "2023-01-01T00:00:00Z").
args.name: value

fields.description: Retrieves this container plus the given label.
fields.name: withLabel

args.description: Location of the cache directory (e.g., "/cache/node_modules").
args.name: path

args.description: Identifier of the cache volume to mount.
args.name: cache

args.description: Identifier of the directory to use as the cache volume's root.
args.name: source

args.description: Sharing mode of the cache volume.
args.name: sharing

args.description:
A user:group to set for the mounted cache directory.

Note that this changes the ownership of the specified mount along with the
initial filesystem provided by source (if any). It does not have any effect
if/when the cache has already been created.

The user and group can either be an ID (1000:1000) or a name (foo:bar).

If the group is omitted, it defaults to the same as the user.
args.name: owner

fields.description: Retrieves this container plus a cache volume mounted at the given path.
fields.name: withMountedCache

args.description: Location of the mounted directory (e.g., "/mnt/directory").
args.name: path

args.description: Identifier of the mounted directory.
args.name: source

args.description:
A user:group to set for the mounted directory and its contents.

The user and group can either be an ID (1000:1000) or a name (foo:bar).

If the group is omitted, it defaults to the same as the user.
args.name: owner

fields.description: Retrieves this container plus a directory mounted at the given path.
fields.name: withMountedDirectory

args.description: Location of the mounted file (e.g., "/tmp/file.txt").
args.name: path

args.description: Identifier of the mounted file.
args.name: source

args.description:
A user or user:group to set for the mounted file.

The user and group can either be an ID (1000:1000) or a name (foo:bar).

If the group is omitted, it defaults to the same as the user.
args.name: owner

fields.description: Retrieves this container plus a file mounted at the given path.
fields.name: withMountedFile

args.description: Location of the secret file (e.g., "/tmp/secret.txt").
args.name: path

args.description: Identifier of the secret to mount.
args.name: source

args.description:
A user:group to set for the mounted secret.

The user and group can either be an ID (1000:1000) or a name (foo:bar).

If the group is omitted, it defaults to the same as the user.
args.name: owner

args.description:
Permission given to the mounted secret (e.g., 0600).
This option requires an owner to be set to be active.

Default: 0400.
args.name: mode

fields.description: Retrieves this container plus a secret mounted into a file at the given path.
fields.name: withMountedSecret

args.description: Location of the temporary directory (e.g., "/tmp/temp_dir").
args.name: path

fields.description: Retrieves this container plus a temporary directory mounted at the given path.
fields.name: withMountedTemp

args.description: Location of the written file (e.g., "/tmp/file.txt").
args.name: path

args.description: Content of the file to write (e.g., "Hello world!").
args.name: contents

args.description:
Permission given to the written file (e.g., 0600).

Default: 0644.
args.name: permissions

args.description:
A user:group to set for the file.

The user and group can either be an ID (1000:1000) or a name (foo:bar).

If the group is omitted, it defaults to the same as the user.
args.name: owner

fields.description: Retrieves this container plus a new file written at the given path.
fields.name: withNewFile

args.description:
Registry's address to bind the authentication to.
Formatted as [host]/[user]/[repo]:[tag] (e.g. docker.io/dagger/dagger:main).
args.name: address

args.description: The username of the registry's account (e.g., "Dagger").
args.name: username

args.description: The API key, password or token to authenticate to this registry.
args.name: secret

fields.description: Retrieves this container with a registry authentication for a given address.
fields.name: withRegistryAuth

fields.description: Initializes this container from this DirectoryID.
fields.name: withRootfs

args.description: The name of the secret variable (e.g., "API_SECRET").
args.name: name

args.description: The identifier of the secret value.
args.name: secret

fields.description: Retrieves this container plus an env variable containing the given secret.
fields.name: withSecretVariable

args.description: A name that can be used to reach the service from the container
args.name: alias

args.description: Identifier of the service container
args.name: service

fields.description:
Establish a runtime dependency on a service.

The service will be started automatically when needed and detached when it is
no longer needed, executing the default command if none is set.

The service will be reachable from the container via the provided hostname alias.

The service dependency will also convey to any files or directories produced by the container.
fields.name: withServiceBinding

args.description: Location of the forwarded Unix socket (e.g., "/tmp/socket").
args.name: path

args.description: Identifier of the socket to forward.
args.name: source

args.description:
A user:group to set for the mounted socket.

The user and group can either be an ID (1000:1000) or a name (foo:bar).

If the group is omitted, it defaults to the same as the user.
args.name: owner

fields.description: Retrieves this container plus a socket forwarded to the given Unix socket path.
fields.name: withUnixSocket

args.description: The user to set (e.g., "root").
args.name: name

fields.description: Retrieves this container with a different command user.
fields.name: withUser

args.description: The path to set as the working directory (e.g., "/app").
args.name: path

fields.description: Retrieves this container with a different working directory.
fields.name: withWorkdir

args.description: The name of the environment variable (e.g., "HOST").
args.name: name

fields.description: Retrieves this container minus the given environment variable.
fields.name: withoutEnvVariable

args.description: Port number to unexpose
args.name: port

args.description: Port protocol to unexpose
args.name: protocol

fields.description: Unexpose a previously exposed port.
fields.name: withoutExposedPort

fields.description:
Indicate that subsequent operations should not be featured more prominently
in the UI.

This is the initial state of all containers.
fields.name: withoutFocus

args.description: The name of the label to remove (e.g., "org.opencontainers.artifact.created").
args.name: name

fields.description: Retrieves this container minus the given environment label.
fields.name: withoutLabel

args.description: Location of the cache directory (e.g., "/cache/node_modules").
args.name: path

fields.description: Retrieves this container after unmounting everything at the given path.
fields.name: withoutMount

args.description:
Registry's address to remove the authentication from.
Formatted as [host]/[user]/[repo]:[tag] (e.g. docker.io/dagger/dagger:main).
args.name: address

fields.description: Retrieves this container without the registry authentication of a given address.
fields.name: withoutRegistryAuth

args.description: Location of the socket to remove (e.g., "/tmp/socket").
args.name: path

fields.description: Retrieves this container with a previously added Unix socket removed.
fields.name: withoutUnixSocket

fields.description: Retrieves the working directory for all commands.
fields.name: workdir

If allowParentDirPath is true, the path argument can be a directory path, in which case
